H0.text: 6 a.m. is approximately when the Sun reaches its highest point in the sky for an observer in New York State.

H1.text: Noon is the approximate time of day when the Sun is at the highest point in the sky for an observer in New York State.

H2.text: 6 p.m. is the approximate time of day when the Sun is at its highest point in the sky for an observer in New York State.

H3.text: Midnight is the approximate time of day when the Sun is at the highest point in the sky to an observer in New York State.

A4.text: Solar noon is the moment when the Sun contacts the observer's meridian (culmination or meridian transit), reaching its highest position above the horizon.
